snippet.title: Sudoku's Craziest Ever Puzzle?
snippet.description:
*** Today's Sudoku***

What on Earth is this puzzle?!  It's called "Trapped By A Killer" and it's been created by SudokuExplorer.  This sudoku should come with a warning because it is absolutely mad!  

You can play it at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/862N79FrfR

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage.  Digits cannot repeat within a cage.

If you'd like to try jovi_al's Negativity - an amazing new classic sudoku - then you can at the following link:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/mdtTb9qmhp

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. 

There is a bonus video on Patreon right now on how to solve this puzzle!  
(As well as December's monthly reward!!)

snippet.title: A Staggering Puzzle Mash-Up
snippet.description:
▶  NEW SUDOKU PUZZLE HUNT JUST OUT ◀
You can find our brand new sudoku hunt on Patreon now!  Can you unlock the secrets of the Wonders Of The World?!!  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

*********************************************************************

Today's puzzle is another from one of the most popular constructors in the world, Jesper!  And it's a mash-up of two of our most requested puzzles types - Star Battle and Pentominous!!  You can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/2f4fTR6t6B

Rules: 
Place pentominoes in the grid, and stars within some squares of those pentominoes, so that all the following conditions are met: a) Exactly 2 stars appear in each row, in each column, and in each of the 12 standard pentomino types; b) Pentominoes must cover the whole grid, except the 4 central squares (shaded black); c) Two pentominoes of the same type may not share an edge (a rotation/reflection of a pentomino does not change its type); d) Stars may not be adjacent to each other (not even diagonally); e) Some borders between pentominoes are already given, and must be respected. Note that each individual pentomino can contain 0, 1 or 2 stars, as long as the total number of stars within all pentominoes of its type is exactly 2.

You can find a picture of all 12 pentominoes here:
https://logic-masters.de/Raetselportal/Raetsel/zeigen.php?id=00049Q

▶  SIMON VS PHISTOMEFEL ◀
If you'd like to try the Phistomefel's Yin-Yang Fillomino, you can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/49gg9R9jT6

Rules and example puzzle can be found here:
https://logic-masters.de/Raetselportal/Raetsel/zeigen.php?id=00053V

A (long) video of Simon doing battle with this puzzle is out now on Patreon.

snippet.title: Did This Sudoku Make Us Cry?
snippet.description:
We were told this puzzle by the great Phistomefel might make us cry...  did it and, if so, why!?  You can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/BJRQ4DnFp3

Rules: 
Normal Sudoku rules apply. Cells separated by a knight’s move (in chess) cannot contain the same digit.  Digits on a line between two circles must lie between the circled ends (ie greater than the lower of the two circled digits and lower than the greater of the two circled digits).  The digits along an arrow add to the digit in the associated circled cell. Digits can repeat on the arrow if allowed by the other rules. 

Please follow us on Twitter: @crypticcracking

snippet.title: The Gordian Knot
snippet.description:
▶  NEW SUDOKU PUZZLE HUNT JUST OUT ◀
You can find our brand new sudoku hunt on Patreon now!  Can you unlock the secrets of the wonders of the world?!!  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

*********************************************************************
Today's puzzle is this spectacular sudoku themed on the Gordian Knot by Joseph Nehme.  Will you be Alexander The Great and cut through it?!  You can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/rb7G2grJmN

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply.  Both marked main diagonals must also contain all of the digits 1 to 9, once each.  In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage.  Digits cannot repeat within a cage.  Clues outside the grid give the sum of the digits along the indicated diagonal.  Digits can repeat along these diagonals (providing normal sudoku rules are still obeyed).

▶Simon vs Phistomefel◀
If you'd like to try Phistomefel's Yin-Yang Fillomino, you can play it here:

snippet.title: The Puzzle That Fools Simon
snippet.description:
▶  NEW SUDOKU PUZZLE HUNT JUST OUT ◀
You can find our brand new sudoku hunt on Patreon now!  Can you unlock the secrets of the Wonders Of The World?!!  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

*********************************************************************

Today's puzzle is a beauty!  It was created by Cam Dennis and it fools Simon again and again.  You can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/74pnqPrLt2

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply.  In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage.  Digits may not repeat along each of the marked diagonals.  Cells separated by a "taxicab" distance of 4 may not contain the same digit.  A "taxicab" distance from cell A to cell B is the minimum possible distance from cell A to cell B when traversed only through orthogonal cells. In other words if two cells are H horizontal moves and V vertical moves away from each other, their taxicab distance from one another is H+V.

▶  SIMON VS PHISTOMEFEL ◀
If you'd like to try the Phistomefel's Yin-Yang Fillomino, you can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/49gg9R9jT6

Rules and example puzzle can be found here:
https://logic-masters.de/Raetselportal/Raetsel/zeigen.php?id=00053V

A (long) video of Simon doing battle with this puzzle is out now on Patreon.

snippet.title: The Final Boss Of Thermo Sudoku
snippet.description:
▶  NEW SUDOKU PUZZLE HUNT OUT TODAY ◀
You can find our brand new sudoku hunt on Patreon now!  Can you unlock the secrets of the ancient world?!!  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

*********************************************************************

Today's puzzle has been recommended to us several times over the last few days.  It's called The Tree and it marks a debut on the channel for the setter Garford.  This is a weird and wonderful sudoku and you can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/6tnBLrmPgh

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. The tree branches are populated by 2-digit numbers where the tens digit is placed before the units digit seen from the stem (ie the bulb in box 8) - in other words, tens and units digits are alternating along the lines.  The bulb includes the first number, read from left to right. The 2-digit numbers must increase along the branches. When a branch separates, the 2-digit numbers on all new branches must be greater than the 2-digit number on the preceding "parent branch". The 2-digit numbers must not repeat across the whole tree.

If you'd like to try the Phistomefel Yin-Yang Fillomino mentioned in the introduction to the video, you can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/49gg9R9jT6

snippet.title: Where In The World Is This Sudoku From?
snippet.description:
*** Today's Sudoku***

And now for something a bit different!  Today's puzzle, which is by Hraf, uses the real geography of the Wirral Peninsula in just a wonderful sudoku that's dedicated to Hraf's grandparents:

"This puzzle is dedicated to my grandparents who are from Liverpool:
My grandfather, who passed earlier this year; but especially to my
grandmother, who taught me from a young age to love puzzles and encouraged my curiosity about the world."

You can play it at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/GMmTTqFhp2

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. The blue areas represent the water surrounding the Wirral Peninsula. The green areas are land. On land, the digit in a cell represents the height of a skyscraper built in that cell. No skyscrapers can be built on water, so any digit can appear on water without affecting sightlines. Sightlines to a shorter building are blocked by taller buildings. The cages represent places where photographs were taken by a photographer on a boat cruise. The small arrow in a cage represents the direction the photographer was facing. Additionally, the digit given in the cage represents the number of skyscrapers visible in the given direction. In places where multiple photographs were taken, all of the photographs will be clued in the same cage. The digit in the cell with a grey square is even. Note: Because no skyscrapers are built on water, no digits in those cells block sightline to any land which may be across the water from the photographer.

*** Join The Best Sudoku Club On Earth ***
If you'd like to try jovi_al's Negativity - an amazing new classic sudoku - then you can at the following link:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/mdtTb9qmhp

snippet.title: Lady Or The Tiger: The Classic Riddle
snippet.description:
*** Today's Sudoku***

We love innovations in sudoku and ZegreS' idea to make sudokus that are hybrids with famous riddles tickles us pink.  We did one of these a couple of weeks ago and here's another one!  This time it borrows from a famous riddle in The Lady Or The Tiger by Raymond Smullyan.  Who would be the reward behind the door if you had a choice?  If we get enough replies we'll reveal our most desired party guests X)

You can play it at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/6nb6Ndf63L

Rules: 
Riddle part:
A lovably eccentric king has put before you a test. Choose one of three doors and encounter either: a lady (represented by the digit 1) who is the life and soul of a party or a tiger (represented by the digit 9) struggling with intermittent fasting. Behind two doors (in the cage) is a tiger (9) and no lady (1). Behind one door (in the cage) is a lady (1) and no tiger (9).  Signs hang above each door: Above Room 1: A tiger is in room 2. Above Room 2: A tiger is in this room. Above Room 3: A tiger is in room 1. The king tells you: The sign on the room with the lady is TRUE and at least one of the other signs is FALSE.  Answer the riddle, solve the sudoku, don't get eaten.  

Sudoku part (having noted the implications for the digits 1 and 9 from the riddle part above):
Normal sudoku rules apply.  In cages, digits sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage. Digits along an arrow sum to the digit in that arrow’s circle. Cells with a grey circle must contain an odd digit. Cells separated by a white dot must contain consecutive digits.  Cells separated by a black dot contain digits with a ratio of 1:2.  Not all dots are given.

If you'd like to try jovi_al's Negativity - an amazing new classic sudoku - then you can at the following link:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/mdtTb9qmhp

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply.

snippet.title: A Brand-New Trick For Classic Sudoku
snippet.description:
▶ KICKSTARTER LAUNCH LINK◀

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/peterchayward/cracking-the-cryptics-greatest-hits?ref=docedl



After an amazing first day, we have hit the target to make the book!  Now we just hope we can reach the stretch goals to include the new puzzles!!
 

***************************************

Today's puzzle is a classic sudoku called T-Rex by Macrovius.  It's a beautiful puzzle for explaining/showcasing some advanced techniques.  We also revisit Tatooine Sunset by Philip Newman to discuss an extraordinary technique brought to our attention by Tom Collyer and Sam Cappleman-Lynes:  the multi sector locked sets (MSLS) idea is incredibly interesting so we thought you'd enjoy seeing how it can help start this brutal sudoku.

snippet.title: The Golden Age Of Sudoku Puzzles
snippet.description:
Today's sudoku is called The Mods Are Asleep and it's by SSG.  This is a brilliant puzzle, full of gorgeous logic.  It's also rated of only "average" difficulty on Logic Masters Germany.  (We'd love your feedback on that!)  This is just the latest in a series of extraordinary sudokus, this truly is a blessed time to be a puzzler.  You can play it at the following link: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/7tF7DBtJn2

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Digits along an arrow must sum to the digit in that arrow's circle. Each purple line must contain a non-repeating set of consecutive digits (in any order).

*** Two Truths And A Lie by zetamath ***
This puzzle is incredible, one of the best we've ever seen.  But it does contain an enormous ruleset - especially if the rules are fully explained.  Give the puzzle a try on the link below and watch out for Simon's video on how to solve it.  The video will appear on Patreon tonight and on the channel next week at some point.

snippet.title: Is This The Greatest Quadruple In Sudoku History?
snippet.description:
Today's puzzle is called Quorum Rings and it's another of these sudokus that seems to defy belief.  It's a debut on the channel for Jay Dyer and you'll want to be having a go at this one!  

You can play the puzzle at the following link: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/H8JHPgbjtj

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Digits may not repeat on either main diagonal (marked in blue). In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage.  Digits cannot repeat within a cage. The clue outside the grid gives the sum of the digits on the indicated diagonal.  Digits may repeat along this diagonal if allowed by other rules.

*** Two Truths And A Lie by zetamath ***
This puzzle is incredible, one of the best we've ever seen.  But it does contain an enormous ruleset - especially if the rules are fully explained. snippet.title: The Ultimate Sudoku Gift
snippet.description:
JoWovrin made a puzzle for fellow constructor jovi_al as a birthday present.  This is some gift - it has a 100% rating on Logic Masters Germany and 5/5 stars for difficulty.  Oh and it involves "friendly" cells :)

You can play Friends² at the following link: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/LLDprBq3FH

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Green cells are "friendly" cells ie They contain their row/column/box number; eg r5c9 could be 5(row), 9(column) or 6(box).  There are EXACTLY 2 friendly cells in every row/column/box of the grid.

*** Two Truths And A Lie by zetamath ***
This puzzle is incredible, one of the best we've ever seen.  But it does contain an enormous ruleset - especially if the rules are fully explained.  Give the puzzle a try on the link below and watch out for Simon's video on how to solve it out tomorrow on the channel.  (The video is available already for patrons of the channel on Patreon).

snippet.title: Sudoku Is No Longer Just About The Digits 1 to 9!
snippet.description:
*** Today's Sudoku***

Another masterpiece of originality today as Kit combines sudoku with the awesome Japanese pencil puzzle Heyawake.  This is SUCH a cool idea and it's executed beautifully. 

You can play it at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/jQQf2DBMLT

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Digits cannot repeat in cages or along the main (marked) diagonals. Each cell in the grid must be shaded dark or light according to the following rules: 1) within cages, the dark cells will sum to the cage's total (if given); 2) dark cells may not be orthogonally adjacent to one another;  3) all the light cells must be orthogonally connected in a single group; 4) a straight (orthogonal) line of light cells cannot span across more than two cages; and 5) the dark cells along the two main diagonals must sum to the same total.

If you'd like to try jovi_al's Negativity then you can at the following link:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/mdtTb9qmhp

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. 

There is a bonus video on Patreon right now on how to solve this puzzle!  
(As well as December's monthly reward!!)

snippet.title: Can You Keep Up With The Rules Changes In Sudoku?
snippet.description:
▶ SUDOKU PAD - Our New App  ◀

It's OUT on Windows (released yesterday!) via Steam here:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1706870/Svens_SudokuPad/

You can now input your own classic sudoku puzzles into our software using our new App!  The app also comes with 12 handmade puzzles from us and we're also releasing occasional bonus puzzles too.  Already available on IOS and Android.

*** Today's Sudoku ***

Today's sudoku is the 5th puzzle in a series of "Build Your Own" from the wonderful Joseph Nehme.  It's incredible how much can be done with just these small changes to the rules we know and love. This is definitely an approachable sudoku (genuinely!) so do give it a try if you have the time. Play the puzzle at the following link:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/JH8hqjFfD9

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage.  Digits cannot repeat within a cage. The cages themselves must be deduced; each cage contains a "renban" that spans ALL of its cells.  The line must start at the killer cage sum clue and move horizontally and vertically through cells (but not diagonally).  The line must not branch.  NB As usual, the killer cage total must always be in the upper left corner of the cage (uppermost prioritised over leftmost). Cells connected by a "renban" line must contain consecutive digits in any order.  Cages may not overlap.

snippet.title: Red Light Green Light - Sudoku Squid Game
snippet.description:
▶ SUDOKU PAD - Our New App  ◀

It's just OUT on Windows via Steam here:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1706870/Svens_SudokuPad/

You can now input your own classic sudoku puzzles into our software using our new App!  The app also comes with 12 handmade puzzles from us and we're also releasing occasional bonus puzzles too.  Already available on IOS and Android.

*** Today's Sudoku ***

This is an awesome take on the "Squid Game" Red Light Green Light from the Netflix series from Piatato.  It's such a clever implementation of the idea and SO much fun to solve.  Play the puzzle at the following link:
Version with flavour text rules: https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/8jPnpjrnr6

Version with plain rules:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/hnrnDL7Q8L

Rules (flavour text version):
Normal sudoku rules apply.  In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage (if given).  Digits cannot repeat within a cage. The solver must run along an orthogonally connected path that starts and ends in the green cells. While on a green light, the solver must run as fast as they can and while on a red light they must try not to move. Speed is represented by the value of the digits! The solver is on a green light as long as the path goes on cells that aren't part of a killer cage. On these green cells the solver must keep up speed thus these cells must all contain high digits (6 or higher).  If the path crosses a killer cage, the solver has got a red light.  Here the solver must stay as still as they can in order not to be killed thus the red cells must contain low digits (4 or lower).  The path does not touch itself orthogonally or diagonally.

Rules (plain version):
Normal sudoku rules apply.  In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage (if given).  Digits cannot repeat within a cage. Find an orthogonally connected path that starts and ends in the green cells. Digits on the path that are inside killer cages must be low (4 or lower); cells on the path that are outside of killer cages must be high (6 or higher). The path does not touch itself orthogonally or diagonally.

*** More Patreon Content ***
Simon released a video on Patreon last week where he attempts the first 8 puzzles from the new Genuinely Approachable Pencil Puzzle series on Discord.  We also got solution videos for the Japanese Sums Sudoku Hunt out and the December reward just around the corner! You can join us on Patreon for as little as $2/month here:

snippet.title: Find The Path Through The Bodies!
snippet.description:
***Thanks to everyone who helped with our Google PlayStore issue.  Our Thermo Sudoku and Miracle Sudoku apps will be reinstated shortly.  Hooray! ***

In today's puzzle we have to make our way through the graveyard!  This puzzle is proving incredibly popular.  It's by fjam and you'll love it!  You can play the Graveyard Of Ideas at the following link: 

https://tinyurl.com/graveyardofideas

Rules: 
Normal Sudoku rules apply. In graves (cages), digits must sum to the day, month or year of the date on the grave. Digits cannot repeat within graves. Escape the graveyard by carefully plotting an orthogonally connected path between the green and red cells. The path may not cross the highest or lowest digits in a grave. 

*** Botaku Bonus Puzzle *** 
As mentioned in the video, we have a bonus puzzle today from the brilliant Botaku.  It's called Euclidean Sudoku!  You can play it at the link below and watch a video of Simon solving it on our Patreon page.

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

Play the puzzle here:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/tMmgPBBP93
SudokuPad link: https://tinyurl.com/4t74y7rs

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Given two cells which both contain the digit N, the Euclidean distance between (the centres of) those cells must be at least √N times the sidelength of a single cell. In other words, if moving from one such cell to the other takes X horizontal steps and Y  vertical steps, then √(X^2 + Y^2) ≥ √N. 

▶ SUDOKU PAD - Our New App  ◀
You can now input your own classic sudoku puzzles into our software using our new App!  The app also comes with 12 handmade puzzles from us and we're also releasing occasional bonus puzzles too.  Get SudokuPad at these links:

iOS:
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/svens-sudokupad/id1570622073

Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.svencodes.sudokupad

**************************************************************

snippet.description:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/GPf6JTG4G6

Normal sudoku rules apply. Along purple lines, digits must form a sequence of non-repeating consecutive digits, in any order.  Along thermometers, digits must increase from the bulb end. Cells separated by an X must contain digits summing to 10.  Not all possible Xs are given.

snippet.title: This Sudoku Knocks Our Socks Off
snippet.description:
▶ KICKSTARTER LINK◀

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/peterchayward/cracking-the-cryptics-greatest-hits?ref=docedl

After an amazing first couple of days, we have hit the target to make the book!  Now we just hope we can reach the stretch goals to include the new puzzles!!  Please help us get there if you can!

**********************************************************************
▶Today's Puzzle◀

Today's puzzle is by a new name to us, apiyo, but this is as good a sudoku as you'll ever find.  You can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/webapp/M4Hjb83P9G

Rules: 

Normal sudoku rules apply. Cells that's are a Knight's move apart from each other cannot contain the same digit. Cells along a grey line must form a palindrome. Clues outside the grid indicate the sum of the digits along the indicated diagonal. Digits may repeat along these diagonals (providing digits do not repeat in a 3x3 box).

snippet.title: Fermat's Last Sudoku
snippet.description:
Peter Veenis (Sudoku's very own Pierre de Fermat) has scribbled in the margins of his notebook about a wonderful proof he has discovered that would help solvers understand his latest puzzle.  Can you prove Veenis' Latest Theorem and crack one of the greatest sudokus of all time?  You can play the puzzle at the following link: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/33MN2jT4Hf

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Digits along an arrow must sum to the digit in that arrow's circle. In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage (if given). Along each main diagonal (marked in blue) digits cannot repeat.

snippet.title: Does THIS Puzzle Deserve 3 Million Views?
snippet.description:
BIG NEWS:  We have reached 5,000 patrons on Patreon yesterday.  A huge thank you to everyone who is supporting us.  As a result we have released the Sudoku Murder Mystery Hunt FREE on Patreon.  Just follow the link below and get cracking the crime!!!  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

We noticed today that The Miracle Sudoku has just tipped over 3million views... an extraordinary number we have trouble believing!  Today's puzzle has elements in common with The Miracle - it seems impossible to start and, even if you can start, how on earth will it finish?  It's called nabneR and it's by zetamath and this puzzle deserves all the attention it should get!!  Please have a go at it at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/fpmB4ppfMp

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply.  Cells separated by a white dot contain consecutive digits.  Cells separated by a black dot contain digits with a ratio of 1:2.  Not all possible dots are given.  Each purple line cannot contain a repeated digit; nor can it contain ANY consecutive digits.  eg if a line has a 3 anywhere on it then neither 2 nor 4 can appear on that line.

▶ MORE PATREON MADNESS ◀
Jovi_al's 20-puzzle Sudoku Extravaganza is just OUT.  We also are offering an incredible prize created by Anita Berge - many many thanks Anita - which is a pillow throw featuring the first puzzle in Jovi_al's set.  To have a chance of the prize, send the message you get when you've completed puzzle 20 to us at crackingthecryptic@gmail.com

snippet.title: A Puzzle To Make Programmers Happy!
snippet.description:
Today's puzzle is a stunner from Mr. Menace called Killin' It.  It's a hybrid of 159 sudoku and killer sudoku and the logic is so gorgeous.  You can play the puzzle at the following link: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/PB6TdhDJGR

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage.  Digits cannot repeat within a cage. Digits in column 1 indicate the column in which the digit 1 appears in that row (eg if r4c1 is a 6, r4c6 is a 1).  The same is true of column 5 and the digit 5, and column 9 and the digit 9.

*** Our Patreon - The Best Sudoku Club In The World *** 
You can join us on Patreon for as little as $2/month and access a lot of extra content.  Recent Patreon specials include Simon solving a Botaku sudoku (Euclidean Sudoku), the Lockout Lines Sudoku Hunt and Mark solving ridiculously hard cryptic crosswords.  Upcoming releases include a 45-puzzle Japanese Sum Sudoku Extravaganza from Panthera and TheAsylm where every puzzle creates a picture!

Today's puzzle is suitable for everyone and it is a joy to solve.  It's by tenaliraman and you can play it here:

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply.  Clues outside the grid give the sum of the digits along the indicated diagonal. Digits along the diagonal may repeat if allowed by other rules. In the grid, the digits along the path of an arrow sum to the digit in that arrow’s circled cell. Digits along the arrow path may repeat if allowed by other rules. Digits along a grey lines form a palindrome i.e. the sequence of digits reads the same forwards and backwards e.g. 1234321.

snippet.title: The "Empty Grid" Sudoku
snippet.description:
*** Join Simon at 10pm UK time tonight - 90 minutes after this video goes live - for his attempt at The Music Box Challenge in The Witness.  Link here:
https://youtu.be/HClxzvx1DQs

*****

We suspect you won't have seen a sudoku like today's ever before.  Not even The Miracle Sudoku was quite so sparse.  That's right Empty Grid by Jodawo literally has nothing in the grid at all.  What is going on?!?! You can play the puzzle at the following link: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/MLt47676Pr

Rules: 
In this puzzle ‘2-digit numbers’ read from left to right or downwards. Box 1 (NW) will contain all the 2-digit square numbers (16, 25, 36, 49, 64, and 81), which may overlap but must be entirely contained within the box. Box 9 (SE) is a clone of box 1, rotated through 180°. In each of boxes 3 (NE), 5 (centre) and 7 (SW), each digit will contribute to at least one 2-digit prime number contained within that box. Box 4 (W) is a magic square, with each row, column, and 3-digit diagonal summing to the same total. In each of box 6 (E) and 8 (S), the two 3-digit diagonals sum to the same number (NB box 6's number may be different from box 8's number).

*** Botaku Bonus Puzzle *** 
As mentioned in the video, we have a bonus puzzle today from the brilliant Botaku.  It's called Euclidean Sudoku!  You can play it at the link below and watch a video of Simon solving it on our Patreon page.

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

Play the puzzle here:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/tMmgPBBP93
SudokuPad link: https://tinyurl.com/4t74y7rs

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Given two cells which both contain the digit N, the Euclidean distance between (the centres of) those cells must be at least √N times the sidelength of a single cell. In other words, if moving from one such cell to the other takes X horizontal steps and Y  vertical steps, then √(X^2 + Y^2) ≥ √N.

snippet.title: Astonishing Sudoku: An Hour Of Pure Magic
snippet.description:
*** More Bonus Patreon Content ***
Simon has released a video on Patreon today where he attempts the first 8 puzzles from the new Genuinely Approachable Pencil Puzzle series on Discord.  These puzzles are awesome! You can join us on Patreon for as little as $2/month here:  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

*** Today's Sudoku ***

Today's sudoku is MAJESTIC.  This is a tour de force by Lizzy01 with some dazzling logic - do give yourself a bit of joy by having a crack at it, you won't regret it!  You can play the puzzle at the following link:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/FLqFBMpTJB

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Along thermometers, digits must increase from the bulb end. Digits along an arrow must sum to the digit in that arrow's circle. The clue outside the grid gives the sum of the digits along the indicated diagonal.  These digits may repeat if allowed by other rules.  The main diagonal marked in blue cannot contain a repeated digit. Digits on the diamond endpoints of a purple line must have a difference of at least 4 and the remaining digits on the line cannot be between or equal to the digits on the endpoints.

*** Our Book ***
The PDF is available as of today and the physical copy shouldn't be far behind.  If you don't own the book then it can still be ordered here:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/peterchayward/cracking-the-cryptics-greatest-hits/

snippet.title: The XV Files
snippet.description:
▶Today's Puzzle◀

Today's puzzle is an absolute gem by Philipp Huber.  It's called XV Kropki and you won't regret any minutes you spend in its company.  You can play the puzzle here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/webapp/LTR8GR7D84

Rules:  
Normal Sudoku rules apply. Cells separated by:
 - an X sum to 10
 - a V sum to 5
 - a black dot have a 1:2 ratio
 - a white dot have a difference of 1.
No negative constraints apply.  (eg if cells do NOT have an X between them then they CAN still sum to 10 etc.)


**************************************************************
As mentioned in the video we have two wonderful treats available at the moment on Patreon (link below).  The first is the collection of Modern Art themed sudokus from our Discord server (also linked below).  These are completely free - just visit Patreon and download!

You can play it at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/Qdm8h9FQfh

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage. Digits may not repeat within a cage. Along thermometers, digits must increase from the bulb end. Digits on a black dot must have a ratio of 1:2, digits on a white dot must be consecutive. Not all possible dots are given. Cells with a grey circle have to be odd, cells with a grey square have to be even.

snippet.title: WHAT Did 14 Geniuses Create?!
snippet.description:
Today's puzzle is a very special one - it's been created by no less than 14 of the world's great setters!  All is explained in the video but this is a sudoku you won't want to miss.  You can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/LNqP9d8tdj

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. The grey circle is odd and the grey square is even. Digits along the blue line must be between the values at each end of that line. Digits along an arrow sum to the value in the associated circle. (The two-digit pill should be read as a two-digit number from left to right for these purposes.) Digits in a cage do not repeat; if a value is given for the cage, the digits sum to that value. Digits along a thermometer must increase from the bulb end. The orange cell is greater than the four digits orthogonally adjacent to it. Two cells separated by a black dot must have a 1:2 ratio. Digits along the marked brown diagonal may not repeat.

snippet.title: The Hardest Sudoku Of Them All: Simon Vs Phistomefel Live
snippet.description:
Simon attempted the new Phistomefel puzzle in a livestream.  It's fair to say this is one of the most extraordinary sudokus ever made.  

You can find the puzzle here with an example of how it works:

https://logic-masters.de/Raetselportal/Raetsel/zeigen.php?id=0008A1

You can play the puzzle here:
https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/fLtm97H9GD

Rules:
Every digit from 1 to 9 has to appear once in every row, column and region. 
The regions first need to be determined. Every region is a set of nine orthogonally connected cells.
A digit in a circle indicates the number of borders between regions it sees in its row and column. Note that the edge of the grid does not count toward this total.
Remark: There is no negative constraint regarding the circle, i.e. there can be uncircled cells containing a digit that equals the number of edges seen in the respective row and column.

Patrons of the channel on Patreon can watch a video where Mark solves the example puzzle from the logic masters link above right now.

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

*** Our Patreon - The Best Sudoku Club In The World *** 
You can join us on Patreon for as little as $2/month and access a lot of extra content.  Today Mark has added his solve of the example from Phistomefel's new puzzle!  This will give you an idea of what Simon will face tomorrow.

snippet.title: The Best Sudoku Puzzle Ever?  We Attempt THAT Puzzle!
snippet.description:
Here it is!  Simon's attempt to solve Two Truths And A Lie by zetamath.  The puzzle with a ruleset as lengthy as the puzzle is brilliant :) 

Note this puzzle originally appeared as a bonus video on our Patreon page (which is why the video introduction is as it is!).  You can support the channel on Patreon here:
https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

The rules to the puzzle are explained in detail below and you can play the puzzle here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/NFhHj2bQ2g

Rules:
Normal sudoku rules apply. Each of the following standard clue types occurs exactly three times in the grid: white dots, black dots, arrow, sandwich, Xs, Vs, thermos, quadruples, odds (grey circles), evens (grey squares), renban (purple) and German whispers (green). For each of those clue types, exactly two of the appearances of that clue are correct and the other is incorrect.  [A clue is incorrect if it is not fully correct.  Eg an incorrect quadruple might see one of the digits but not all of them.]

The "standard" clue types mentioned above are as follows:
White dots:  Cells separated by a white dot must contain consecutive digits.
Black dots: Cells separated by a black dot must be in the ratio of 1:2 (so one digit must be double the other).
Arrow:  Digits on an arrow must sum to the digit in that arrow's circle.
Sandwich:  Clues outside the grid give the sum of the digits sandwiched between the 1 and 9 in that row/column.
Xs:  Cells separated by an X must contain digits summing to 10.
Vs:  Cells separated by a V must contain digits summing to 5.
Thermos: Along a thermometer, digits must increase from the bulb end.
Quadruples: Digits in the small circles in the grid must appear at least once in every cell touched by the circle.
Odds:  Cells containing a grey circle must contain an odd digit.
Evens: Cells containing a grey square must contain an even digit.
Renban: Each purple line must contain a set of non-repeating consecutive digits (which can be in any order).
German Whispers: Adjacent digits on a green line must differ by at least 5.

snippet.title: The Light Bulb Sudoku
snippet.description:
Today's puzzle is a riddle and then a sudoku (and both are brilliant!).  It's called Light Bulb Moment by ZergreS and this is such an innovative idea, we're really blown away. You can play it at the following link:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/JBNhmrn8dq

Rules: 
Riddle: A long hallway has 43 light bulbs on the ceiling. Each light bulb has a pull cord that turns it on and off. All the lightbulbs start turned off. 43 people go down this hallway. The first person pulls every cord: 1,2,3,4... (now all bulbs are on) The second person pulls every other cord: 2,4,6,8... The third person pulls every third cord: 3,6,9,12... And so on with the rest. Finally the 43rd person pulls cord 43. Which bulbs are on after all the people have passed through? Feel free to use the Sudoku Grid to work out the answer.  
Sudoku: Mark the final lit up bulbs in the Sudoku grid. (The hallway starts with Bulb 1 in R1C3) Lit hallway cells are brighter (higher) than their hallway neighbors. Hallway cells get darker (lower) as you get further away from a lit cell. Between every two lit cells in the hallway there will be a darkest (lowest) cell. It can be anywhere between the two lit cells. Arrows show the way through the hall. Digits along an arrow sum to the circled digit.

snippet.title: The Easy Version Of A Phistomefel Sudoku!?
snippet.description:
▶ SUDOKU PAD - Our New App  ◀

It's OUT on Windows TODAY via Steam here:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1706870/Svens_SudokuPad/

Check it out (and the bonus puzzle exclusively for SudokuPad we tweeted today on @crypticcracking).

*** Today's Sudoku ***

Today's sudoku comes from China and it's a slighly easier form of the livestream puzzle Simon attempted earlier in the week.  There is a ton of beautiful logic in this one:  Play the puzzle at the following link:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/6JBh99JDJJ

Rules: 
The grid must be divided into regions, each containing 9 cells.  Each row, column and region must contain the digits 1 to 9 once each. A number outside the grid gives the sum of the first M cells of the row/column from that direction.  M is the number of region borders in that row/column. The 4 cells surrounding a circle must belong to the same region. The 4 cells surrounding a black square belong to exactly three different regions. All unmarked 2x2 areas belong to two or four regions.

*** More Patreon Content ***
Simon released a video on Patreon on Tuesday where he attempts the first 8 puzzles from the new Genuinely Approachable Pencil Puzzle series on Discord.  There are also the solution videos to our November monthly reward, the Japanese Sum Sudoku hunt from Panthera and TheAsylm. You can join us on Patreon for as little as $2/month here:
